title: Citi Named "Clearing Bank of the Year" by Asia Risk
summary: Hong Kong - Citi was named the "Clearing Bank of the Year" by Asia Risk magazine, a trade publication covering the risk management and structured products industry in the Asia-Pacific region. This is the second year in a row that Citi has received this award.
tag-1: Citi Named "Clearing Bank of the Year" by Asia Risk
tag-2: Hong Kong – Citi was named the "Clearing Bank of the Year" by Asia Risk magazine, a trade publication covering the risk management and structured products industry in the Asia-Pacific region. This is the second year in a row that Citi has received this award.
tag-3: Asia Risk cited Citi's ability to help clients navigate new regulatory hurdles such as the Dodd-Frank Act, as well its on-the-ground presence in Singapore, Japan and Australia.
tag-4: "Our focus over the past three years has been building out our clearing capabilities and providing our global clients with a top-tier offering," said Conor Cunningham, Asia-Pacific Head of Futures and OTC Derivatives Clearing. "We are paving the way for Asian dealers and buy-side firms to compete on the same level as other global asset managers."
tag-5: Several recent innovations have fueled Citi's dominance in the Asia-Pacific region, such as the bank's "What If" tool, which enables clients the ability to model their margin requirements across central counterparties to enhance capital efficiency. Citi also recently added additional market coverage and functionality to its Futures and Options Execution Platform, or "CFOX."
tag-6: "We invested heavily in technology and resources to enable our clearing business to grow at a rapid and strategic pace, and this award is a credit to the hard work of our team across the region," said Jerome Kemp, Global Head of Futures and OTC Clearing.
tag-7: Citi was also recently named the "Bank of the Year" by FOW Asia in September and was the first bank to clear a credit index swap for a Japanese client on ICE Clear LLC.
tag-8: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
